paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the Tyr69His (Y69H) variant in the TTR gene, detailing its association with meningovascular amyloidosis and dementia.

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive cognitive decline, ataxia, severe amyloid deposits in leptomeninges
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 72-year-old Italian-American male demonstrated progressive cognitive decline over 13 years punctuated by multiple encephalopathic episodes that included headache, confusion, ataxia and short-term memory loss.

functional_data.summary: Mass spectrometry analysis demonstrated that the amyloid deposits were comprised of over 80% of the variant TTR.

variants.additional_notes: The variant was associated with severe amyloid deposits and cognitive impairment.
key_quotes: We report the neuropathologic findings from a brain autopsy of a 72-year-old man with the rare Tyr69His (Y69H) TTR gene variant, dementia and ataxia.
TTR was undetectable by mass spectrometry in the neocortex subjacent to the subpial amyloid deposits.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single variant in the TTR gene.
